member.name: T:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderVariableClass

member.remarks: The class of a shader variable is not a programming class; the class identifies the variable class such as scalar, vector, object, and so on. D3D_SHADER_VARIABLE_CLASS-typed values are specified in the Class member of the structure.

member.name: T:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderVariableFlags

member.summary: Indicates that the registers assigned to this shader variable were explicitly declared in shader code (instead of automatically assigned by the compiler).

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderVariableFlags.Used
member.summary: Indicates that this variable is used by this shader. This value confirms that a particular shader variable (which can be common to many different shaders) is indeed used by a particular shader.

member.summary: Indicates that this variable is an interface.

member.summary: Indicates that this variable is a parameter of an interface.

member.name: T:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType
member.summary: Values that identify shader parameters that use system-value semantics.
member.remarks: The D3D_NAME values identify shader parameters that have {{predefined system-value}} semantics. These values are used in a shader-signature description. For more information about shader-signature description, see .

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.Undefined
member.summary: This parameter does not use a predefined system-value semantic.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.Position
member.summary: This parameter contains position data.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.ClipDistance
member.summary: This parameter contains clip-distance data.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.CullDistance
member.summary: This parameter contains cull-distance data.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.RenderTargetArrayIndex
member.summary: This parameter contains a render-target-array index.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.ViewportArrayIndex
member.summary: This parameter contains a viewport-array index.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.VertexId
member.summary: This parameter contains a vertex ID.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.PrimitiveId
member.summary: This parameter contains a primitive ID.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.InstanceId
member.summary: This parameter contains an instance ID.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.IsFrontFace
member.summary: This parameter contains data that identifies whether or not the primitive faces the camera.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.SampleIndex
member.summary: This parameter contains a sampler-array index.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalQuadEdgeTessfactor
member.summary: This parameter contains one of four tessellation factors that correspond to the amount of parts that a quad patch is broken into along the given edge. This flag is used to tessellate a quad patch.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalQuadInsideTessfactor
member.summary: This parameter contains one of two tessellation factors that correspond to the amount of parts that a quad patch is broken into vertically and horizontally within the patch. This flag is used to tessellate a quad patch.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalTriEdgeTessfactor
member.summary: This parameter contains one of three tessellation factors that correspond to the amount of parts that a tri patch is broken into along the given edge. This flag is used to tessellate a tri patch.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalTriInsideTessfactor
member.summary: This parameter contains the tessellation factor that corresponds to the amount of parts that a tri patch is broken into within the patch. This flag is used to tessellate a tri patch.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalLineDetailTessfactor
member.summary: This parameter contains the tessellation factor that corresponds to the number of lines broken into within the patch. This flag is used to tessellate an isolines patch.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.FinalLineDensityTessfactor
member.summary: This parameter contains the tessellation factor that corresponds to the number of lines that are created within the patch. This flag is used to tessellate an isolines patch.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.Target
member.summary: This parameter contains render-target data.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.Depth
member.summary: This parameter contains depth data.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.Coverage
member.summary: This parameter contains alpha-coverage data.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.DepthGreaterEqual
member.summary: This parameter signifies that the value is greater than or equal to a reference value. This flag is used to specify conservative depth for a pixel shader.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.SystemValueType.DepthLessEqual
member.summary: This parameter signifies that the value is less than or equal to a reference value. This flag is used to specify conservative depth for a pixel shader.

member.remarks: A resource return type is specified in the ReturnType member of the structure.

member.summary: Return type is an unsigned integer value normalized to a value between 0 and 1.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ResourceReturnType.SNorm
member.summary: Return type is a signed integer value normalized to a value between -1 and 1.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ResourceReturnType.UInt
member.summary: Return type is an unsigned integer.

member.summary: Return type is a floating-point number.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ResourceReturnType.Mixed

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ResourceReturnType.Double
member.summary: Return type is a double-precision value.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ResourceReturnType.Continued
member.summary: Return type is a multiple-dword type, such as a double or uint64, and the component is continued from the previous component that was declared. The first component represents the lower bits.

member.name: M:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.D3D.Compile(System.IntPtr,SharpDX.Size,System.String,SharpDX.Direct3D.ShaderMacro[],System.IntPtr,System.String,System.String,SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderFlags,SharpDX.D3DCompiler.EffectFlags,SharpDX.Direct3D.Blob@,SharpDX.Direct3D.Blob@)
member.summary: Compile HLSL code into bytecode for a given target.
member.param: A reference to uncompiled shader data; either ASCII HLSL code or a compiled effect.
Length of pSrcData.
Optional. The name of the shader file. Use either this or pSrcData.
Optional. An array of NULL-terminated macro definitions (see ).
Optional. A reference to an for handling include files. Setting this to NULL will cause a compile error if a shader contains a #include.
The name of the shader entry point function.
The shader target or set of shader features to compile against.
Shader {{compile options}}.
Effect {{compile options}}. When you compile a shader and not an effect file, D3DCompile ignores Flags2; therefore, you can set Flags2 to zero.
The address of a that contains the compiled code.
Optional. A reference to an that contains compiler error messages, or NULL if there were no errors.
member.returns: Returns one of the following {{Direct3D 10 Return Codes}}.
member.unmanaged: HRESULT D3DCompile([In, Buffer] const void* pSrcData,[In] SIZE_T SrcDataSize,[In, Optional] const char* pSourceName,[In, Buffer, Optional] const D3D_SHADER_MACRO* pDefines,[In, Optional] ID3DInclude* pInclude,[In] const char* pEntrypoint,[In] const char* pTarget,[In] D3DCOMPILE_SHADER_FLAGS Flags1,[In] D3DCOMPILE_EFFECT_FLAGS Flags2,[Out] ID3DBlob** ppCode,[Out, Optional] ID3DBlob** ppErrorMsgs)

member.name: M:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.D3D.Preprocess(System.IntPtr,SharpDX.Size,System.String,SharpDX.Direct3D.ShaderMacro[],System.IntPtr,SharpDX.Direct3D.Blob@,SharpDX.Direct3D.Blob@)
member.summary: Preprocesses uncompiled HLSL code.
member.remarks: D3DPreprocess outputs {{#line}} directives and preserves line numbering of source input so that output line numbering can be properly related to the input source.
member.param: A reference to uncompiled shader data; either ASCII HLSL code or a compiled effect.
Length of pSrcData.
Optional. The name of the file that contains the uncompiled HLSL code.
Optional. An array of NULL-terminated macro definitions (see ).
Optional. A reference to an for handling include files. Setting this to NULL will cause a compile error if a shader contains a #include.
The address of a that contains the compiled code.
Optional. A reference to an that contains compiler error messages, or NULL if there were no errors.
member.returns: Returns one of the following {{Direct3D 10 Return Codes}}.

Optional.
Optional. A reference to an that contains assembly text.
member.returns: Returns one of the following {{Direct3D 10 Return Codes}}.

member.name: T:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderParameterDescription
member.summary: Describes a shader signature.
member.remarks: A shader can take n inputs and can produce m outputs. The order of the input (or output) parameters, their associated types, and any attached semantics make up the shader signature. Each shader has an input and an output signature. When compiling a shader or an effect, some API calls validate shader signatures That is, they compare the output signature of one shader (like a vertex shader) with the input signature of another shader (like a pixel shader). This ensures that a shader outputs data that is compatible with a downstream shader that is consuming that data. Compatible means that a shader signature is a exact-match subset of the preceding shader stage. Exact match means parameter types and semantics must exactly match. Subset means that a parameter that is not required by a downstream stage, does not need to include that parameter in its shader signature. Get a shader-signature from a shader or an effect by calling APIs such as .

member.summary: A per-parameter string that identifies how the data will be used.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderParameterDescription.SemanticIndex
member.summary: Semantic index that modifies the semantic. Used to differentiate different parameters that use the same semantic.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderParameterDescription.Register
member.summary: The register that will contain this variable's data.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderParameterDescription.SystemValueType
member.summary: A predefined string that determines the functionality of certain pipeline stages. See .

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderParameterDescription.ComponentType
member.summary: The per-component-data type that is stored in a register. See . Each register can store up to four-components of data.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderParameterDescription.UsageMask
member.summary: Mask which indicates which components of a register are used.

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderParameterDescription.ReadWriteMask
member.summary: Mask which indicates whether a given component is never written (if the signature is an output signature) or always read (if the signature is an input signature).

member.name: F:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.ShaderParameterDescription.Stream
member.summary: Indicates which stream the geometry shader is using for the signature parameter.

member.name: T:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.IncludeCallback.OpenDelegate
member.summary: A user-implemented method for opening and reading the contents of a shader #include file.
member.param: This pointer
A -typed value that indicates the location of the #include file.
Name of the #include file.
Pointer to the container that includes the #include file.
Pointer to the buffer that Open returns that contains the include directives. This pointer remains valid until is called.
Pointer to the number of bytes that Open returns in ppData.
member.returns: The user-implemented method should return S_OK. If Open fails when reading the #include file, the application programming interface (API) that caused Open to be called fails. This failure can occur in one of the following situations:The high-level shader language (HLSL) shader fails one of the D3D10CompileShader*** functions.The effect fails one of the D3D10CreateEffect*** functions.
member.unmanaged: HRESULT Open([None] D3D_INCLUDE_TYPE IncludeType,[None] const char* pFileName,[None] LPCVOID pParentData,[None] LPCVOID* ppData,[None] UINT* pBytes)

member.name: T:SharpDX.D3DCompiler.IncludeCallback.CloseDelegate
member.summary: A user-implemented method for closing a shader #include file.
member.remarks: If was successful, Close is guaranteed to be called before the API using the interface returns.
member.param: This pointer
Pointer to the buffer that contains the include directives. This is the pointer that was returned by the corresponding call.
member.returns: The user-implemented Close method should return S_OK. If Close fails when it closes the #include file, the application programming interface (API) that caused Close to be called fails. This failure can occur in one of the following situations:The high-level shader language (HLSL) shader fails one of the D3D10CompileShader*** functions.The effect fails one of the D3D10CreateEffect*** functions.
